sentences.sContent: She has a teenage daughter from a previous marriage.
sentences.sCn: 她有个出自前一次婚姻的十几岁的女儿。

sentences.sContent: ...The majority of previous research has focused on how we learn and remember new information...
...each task starts when the previous task is completed...
...14% of the re-employed said the pay in their new job was less than half what they earned in their previous job...
...it comes with its previous owner's highlights and notes in the margins...
...Learning to live without the guarantee of health is like having to unlearn a previous life...
...the university publicly stressed that in her previous job she had overseen a major strengthening of Yale’s financial position...

phrases.pCn: 上一页，前一页；返回上一级菜单
（国会议事程序中作为动议提出的）先决问题

remMethod.val: pre(预先， …前) ＋ vi(路) ＋ ous(…的) → 先的， 前的

trans.tranOther: A previous event or thing is one that happened or existed before the one that you are talking about
